properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 12 at 3:44AM CST until February 13 at 10:00AM CST by NWS Lincoln IL
properties.description:
...SNOW TO SPREAD ACROSS AREAS NORTH OF I-70 BY MIDDAY INTO MID
THURSDAY MORNING...

.Precipitation will lift northward and overspread much of central
Illinois through late morning and into the afternoon, with rain
possibly mixed with sleet south of I-70. While areas north of
I-70 should start as a mix of precipitation, and then turn to all
snow by later this afternoon and early evening. Snow will
continue tonight and diminish during mid to late Thursday
morning, with snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches with locally
4 to 5 inch amounts possible. Much colder air will move into the
area later tonight into Thursday with some blowing and drifting
snow possible especially in open rural areas.

* WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 5
inches.

* WHERE...Portions of central and east central Illinois.

* WHEN...From 11 AM Today to 10 AM CST Thursday.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous
conditions will impact the evening commute, with some
lingering slippery conditions and patchy blowing snow for the
Thursday morning commute.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road
conditions for Illinois can be obtained on the Internet at
www.gettingaroundillinois.com.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM THIS MORNING TO 10 AM CST THURSDAY
